results.title: Mr Strong
results.creator_credit: Terry Ward, Trevor Bond and Animated Flicks Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mr Men”.
An animated adaptation of Roger Hargreaves book of the same title. Mr Strong, as his name suggests, demonstrates his physical prowess.

results.title: D.W. Griffith: father of film
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow, Thames Television and Channel Four
results.brief_description: A three part survey of the life and work of D.W. Griffith. His formative years in the theatre and at Biograph were followed by his major successes between 1915-1921: “The Birth of a nation”, “Broken blossoms”, “Way down east” and “Orphans of the storm”. The subsequently influential “Intolerance” was a critical and commercial failure prefiguring the failure, in the twenties, of “America”, “Isn’t life wonderful” and “The Sorrows of Satan” and later, of his neglected sound films, “Abraham Lincoln” and “The Struggle”. Brownlow and Gill make extensive use of colour-tinted extracts from his films and interviews with Lillian Gish, Blanche Sweet, Karl Brown and others. Narrated by Lindsay Anderson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow, Thames Television and Channel Four

results.title: Jack be nimble
results.creator_credit: Garth Maxwell, Kelly Rogers, Jonathan Dowling, New Zealand Film Commission and Essential Productions
results.brief_description: This gothic horror/melodrama follows the entwined lives of Jack and Dora, deeply connected siblings who suffer lasting trauma after being separated from their parents, then from one another when they are sent to an orphanage and adopted by very different families. While Dora finds loving adoptive parents, the farming family Jack enters treat him brutally, eventually driving him to murder. Reunited with Dora as a teenager, Jack is still unable to let go of his idealised early childhood memories of their lives together with their mother and is consumed by a violent psychotic rage. Meanwhile his four feral sisters from his adoptive family are out to seek revenge for the death of their parents. Cast includes Alexis Arquette, Sara Smuts-Kennedy, Bruno Lawrence.

results.title: Mr Bump
results.creator_credit: Terry Ward, Trevor Bond and Animation Flicks Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mr Men”.
An animated film based on the ‘Mr. Men’ books by Roger Hargreaves. “Mr Bump” is the story of a little man who continuously bumps into things and causes accidents. But one day he finds a job that perfectly suits his unfortunate habit.

results.title: Jack's back
results.creator_credit: Rowdy Herrington, Cassian Elwes, Tim Moore and Palisades Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: It is August 1988, one hundred years since Jack the Ripper committed his brutal murders in the East End of London and now Los Angeles finds itself experiencing that very same fear as a copy-cat “Jack the Ripper” is on the loose, stalking the streets and murdering his prostitute victims in the same cold and calculated manner as his predecessor one hundred years ago. However in this tale, there is an unusual twist to the plot involving a young physician (James Spader) and his twin brother. Cast includes Cynthia Gibb, Jim Haynie, Robert Picardo and Rod Loomis.

results.title: Jack
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Ricardo Mestres, Fred Fuchs, American Zoetrope and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: When a baby is born at ten weeks gestation, he ends up a child living in a man’s body. Kept at home by his parents, Jack is finally forced to enrol in the fourth grade but his physical appearance (as a forty year old man) is the cause of much derision. Confused, and upset, Jack seeks the company of older women whilst being mentored by a caring teacher. A comedy that seeks to convey the multitudinous talents of Robin Williams, “Jack” works must less effectively than its obvious influence “Big” (1988, Penny Marshall), but still succeeds as an intermittently charming comedy about family, childhood and self-acceptance. Cast also includes Diane Lane, Jennifer Lopez, Brian Kerwin, Bill Cosby. Allan Rich.
